method: In a large pan or wok, heat some oil over high heat.
Add the chopped cactus, sliced bell peppers, minced ginger, and minced garlic to the pan.
Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, until the cactus is tender and the peppers are slightly charred.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce and sesame oil to make the marinade.
Pour the marinade over the stir-fried cactus and peppers.
Continue to stir-fry for another 2 minutes, until the marinade is heated through.
Serve the stir-fry over cooked rice.
